alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 9:51AM MDT until April 26 at 7:12AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Glasgow affecting Valley County. For the Milk River...including Saco, Tampico, Malta, Dodson, Glasgow, Nashua...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Glasgow. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Storm drainage valves along Glasgow levee will back-flood into the southside of Glasgow if not closed. Flooding begins on Rahlf Lane off of Highway 24. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM MDT Friday the stage was 30.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM MDT Friday was 30.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning and continue falling to 17.0 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.1 feet on 03/20/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1100 PM MDT.
